What are some limitations to be aware of when working with multi-currency features in Verus, and what are the implications of these limitations?

When using the multi-currency features in Verus, there are some limitations to be aware of to avoid potential issues.

**Limitation 1: IDs with i-addresses as names**
In Verus, you cannot create a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, rather than its calculated ID. This is because using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity that has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. While the protocol does not prevent creating an ID with an i-address as its name, it is not recommended as it can cause problems in various scenarios. To avoid confusion, the naming system will also expand the set of characters that are not allowed for currency registrations.

**Limitation 2: Currency names already in use**
In the Verus Desktop, if a currency is already supported, such as BTC or ETH, you cannot use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain. This limitation is currently an erratum, but it will be resolved before mainnet availability.

### Limitations in multi-currency to be aware of:
1. (GUI and CLI) You will not be able to make a currency from an ID that has a properly encoded i-address as its actual name, not its calculated ID. Generally, the advice is “don’t do that”. Using an i-address when referring to a currency will only be interpreted as referring to the currency or identity which has that i-address calculated based on its name registration. As a general rule, making an ID with an i-address as its name is not prevented by the protocol, but will cause problems whenever an i-address or name may be used (many cases) and will not be supported for creating currencies. To reduce any potential for user confusion, even though the naming system provides will also be expanding the set of characters that will not be allowed for currency registrations.2. (GUI) If a currency is supported in the Verus Desktop already, such as BTC or ETH, you will not be able to use those same named currencies as a PBaaS chain.
